lines: ${loverName} has often spoken about his younger brother, Mike, who goes to college in another state. He would like you to meet him, and then the three of you could go out together for dinner. Are you agreeable to this?

As it turns out, Michael is shy but very endearing. During the evening he confesses to you that he just broke up with a long-time steady and is going through quite a blue period. Later in the evening ${loverName} passes a snide remark about
He is obviously jealous. You notice that ${loverName} is beginning to tease his brother so that he will look foolish in front of you.
#INTERCEDE AND TELL ${LOVERNAME} TO STOP BEING SO HARD ON HIS BROTHER

${loverName} has no right being abusive to his brother. "Sometimes ${loverName} can be so insensitive," you say. The comment catches ${loverName} off guard and he realizes what he is doing. Later, he apologizes. Will you let him off the hook?
That is very kind of you. You must be a very special kind of person.
You both seem to be the type who can be very hostile at times. Perhaps this isn't one of the best areas to be "compatible" in.
You have reinforced ${loverName}'s fear of your allying with his brother and ignoring or neglecting him. He pouts like a child for the rest of the evening.

Some might say this is a cowardly way out of the situation. Later that night, ${loverName} admits that he felt threatened by Michael's ability to capture your attention. He apologizes for acting foolish. Will you forgive him?
